FuncDef:
The ap name ip command configures a name for a specified AP on a master.
The undo ap name ip command deletes a configured AP name.
By default, no name is configured for an AP on a master.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a name for an AP.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 characters, spaces not supported. The first character cannot be a digit or an underscore (_).
When quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies the management IP address of an AP.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
You can use either an AP's name or management IP address to perform the following operations on a master:
Bind the master's Remote-AP interface to the AP's AC interface.Establish a Telnet connection and log in to the AP for management and maintenance.
To use an AP's name to perform these operations, run the ap name command to configure a name for the AP.

Prerequisites
Virtual cluster access has been configured using the virtual-cluster-access command.
